entry.title: Bret Taylor: 2009 Academy Awards Odds: Slumdog, Rourke, Winslet, Cruz Are Favorites (via Google Reader)

td.div: Bret Taylor( Anacommented on this) - Google Reader

div.a: 2009 Academy Awards Odds: Slumdog, Rourke, Winslet, Cruz Are Favorites

td.style: border:0; padding:0; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:10pt; color:#737373; vertical-align:middle
border:0; padding:0; padding-left:12px; padding-right:5px; padding-top: 2px; vertical-align:top
border:0; padding:0; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:10pt; color:#737373; vertical-align:middle

tr.td: "I believe that in order to win an Academy Award, passion is required. Slumdog Millionaire has a passionate zeal among its supporters that will make it virtually unbeatable. Although I have made The Curious Case of Benjamin Button the second choice here, I give it very little chance of winning. It has major studio backing (Paramount), and it is certainly well-respected, but it is more admired than loved. So, for me the betting value is in Milk. Aside from Slumdog, it is the movie with the largest bloc of zealous fans. Gay and gay-friendly Academy members love the movie, and in the shadow of the passage of Proposition 8 in California, Milk is worth a $2 bet at the window." - Bret Taylor

border:0; padding:0; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:10pt; color:#737373; vertical-align:middle

tr.td: If everyone at FriendFeed follows this advice, our little office Oscars pool won't be very exciting :) - Ana

td.style: border:0; padding:0; padding-left:12px; padding-right:5px; padding-top: 2px; vertical-align:top
border:0; padding:0; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:10pt; color:#737373; vertical-align:middle

tr.td: "Here we have a basketball mystery: a player is widely regarded inside the N.B.A. as, at best, a replaceable cog in a machine driven by superstars. And yet every team he has ever played on has acquired some magical ability to win. Solving the mystery is somewhere near the heart of Daryl MoreyâÄôs job." - Nelson Cheng
